costoffice

Source: vignettes/costoffice.Rmd
costoffice.Rmd
library(costoffice)


Retrieve Dataset Info with search_datasets()


search_datasets() retrieves information on the 83 data sets, separated by physician specialty. If you’re searching for one specialty in particular, just supply the specialty argument:


search_datasets(specialty = "cardiac surgery") |> 
  tidytable::glimpse()
#> Rows: 1
#> Columns: 5
#> $ specialty <chr> "cardiac surgery"
#> $ issued    <date> 2022-07-11
#> $ modified  <date> 2022-07-11
#> $ released  <date> 2022-07-14
#> $ csv_url   <chr> "https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/sites/default/files/reso…


The result contains three dates related to the last time the data was updated and the download link for the csv file.


To retrieve information on all of the data sets (83 specialties in total), simply call search_datasets() with no arguments:


search_datasets()
#> # A tidytable: 83 × 5
#>    specialty                            issued     modified   released   csv_url
#>    <chr>                                <date>     <date>     <date>     <chr>  
#>  1 addiction medicine                   2022-07-11 2022-07-11 2022-07-14 https:…
#>  2 advanced heart failure and transpla… 2022-07-11 2022-07-11 2022-07-14 https:…
#>  3 allergy/ immunology                  2022-07-11 2022-07-11 2022-07-14 https:…
#>  4 anesthesiology                       2022-07-11 2022-07-11 2022-07-14 https:…
#>  5 cardiac surgery                      2022-07-11 2022-07-11 2022-07-14 https:…
#>  6 cardiology                           2022-07-11 2022-07-11 2022-07-14 https:…
#>  7 certified clinical nurse specialist  2022-07-11 2022-07-11 2022-07-14 https:…
#>  8 certified nurse midwife              2022-07-11 2022-07-11 2022-07-14 https:…
#>  9 certified registered nurse anesthet… 2022-07-11 2022-07-11 2022-07-14 https:…
#> 10 clinic or group practice             2022-07-11 2022-07-11 2022-07-14 https:…
#> # … with 73 more rows


The 83 available specialties are as follows:

Downloading A Dataset


costoffice uses Mark Fairbanks’ excellent tidytable package underneath the hood (with it using data.table under it’s hood), resulting in much smaller download sizes and lightning fast data operations.


Each individual data set has approximately 43k rows and is roughly 8 MB on disk/in memory.


cardio <- search_datasets(specialty = "cardiology") |> 
  download_dataset()
nrow(cardio)
#> [1] 42959
ncol(cardio)
#> [1] 16
lobstr::obj_size(cardio)
#> 7.91 MB


cardio |> 
  tidytable::slice_sample(n = 10) |> 
  knitr::kable()
specialty zip_code new_code new_price_min new_price_max new_price_mode new_copay_min new_copay_max new_copay_mode est_code est_price_min est_price_max est_price_mode est_copay_min est_copay_max est_copay_mode

Geocoding with zipcodeR


costoffice includes a subset of zip code data from Gavin Rozzi’s amazing zipcodeR package:


data("zipcode_db")
zipcode_db |> 
  tidytable::slice_head() |> 
  knitr::kable()
city county state zip_code lat lng bounds_west bounds_east bounds_north bounds_south
Moody St. Clair County AL 35004 33.62 -86.50 -86.55178 -86.45282 33.66850 33.56269
Adamsville Jefferson County AL 35005 33.59 -86.99 -87.08163 -86.90677 33.63943 33.53390
Adger Jefferson County AL 35006 33.40 -87.20 -87.34170 -87.07163 33.55580 33.32744
Alabaster Shelby County AL 35007 33.22 -86.79 -86.86177 -86.72683 33.27176 33.15020
Alexander City Tallapoosa County AL 35010 32.90 -85.90 -86.10822 -85.76372 33.10446 32.69872


Putting use_zipcoder() in the pipe chain will add this information to the data table:


search_datasets(specialty = "vascular surgery") |> 
  download_dataset() |> 
  tidytable::slice_sample(n = 10) |> 
  use_zipcoder() |> 
  knitr::kable()
city county state zip_code specialty new_code new_price_min new_price_max new_price_mode new_copay_min new_copay_max new_copay_mode est_code est_price_min est_price_max est_price_mode est_copay_min est_copay_max est_copay_mode lat lng bounds_west bounds_east bounds_north bounds_south

Summary Statistics by State


Current average prices & copays by state for an office visit by a New Patient to a Vascular Surgeon:


search_datasets(specialty = "vascular surgery") |> 
  download_dataset() |> 
  use_zipcoder() |> 
  tidytable::select(specialty, 
                    state, 
                    tidytable::starts_with("new_")) |> 
  tidytable::summarise(avg_price_mode = round(mean(new_price_mode), 2),
                       avg_copay_mode = round(mean(new_copay_mode), 2),
                       .by = c(specialty, 
                               state, 
                               new_code)) |> 
  tidytable::drop_na() |> 
  knitr::kable()

Current average prices & copays by state for an office visit by an Established Patient to a Cardiologist:


search_datasets(specialty = "cardiology") |> 
  download_dataset() |> 
  use_zipcoder() |> 
  tidytable::select(specialty, 
                    state, 
                    tidytable::starts_with("est_")) |> 
  tidytable::summarise(avg_price_mode = round(mean(est_price_mode), 2),
                       avg_copay_mode = round(mean(est_copay_mode), 2),
                       .by = c(specialty, 
                               state, 
                               est_code)) |> 
  tidytable::drop_na() |> 
  knitr::kable()
specialty state est_code avg_price_mode avg_copay_mode
